summary: This bill, H.R. 1669, introduced by Mr. Cohen, seeks to reauthorize the Stop, Observe, Ask, and Respond to Health and Wellness Training Program. It amends the Public Health Service Act to extend the program's authorization, replacing the fiscal years 2020-2024 with 2026-2030. The bill focuses on continuing funding for this health and wellness training initiative, suggesting a focus on preventative healthcare measures.
